metadata.title: Standard for the precision of the clock (UCLK) when using a USB 2.0 host/function module of an RX231

sections.content:
Question:
Is there a standard for the precision of the clock (UCLK) when using a USB 2.0 host/function module of an RX231?
Can a system clock at 50 ppm precision be used before PLL input?
Answer:
1. For a USB host:
Because the USB output waveform must satisfy a precision of ±500 ppm, it is recommended that you use the source clock at a precision of ±100 ppm.
2. For a USB function:
Because the USB output waveform must satisfy a precision of ±2500 ppm, it is recommended that you use the source clock at a precision of 500 ppm.
